channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7224] Remove references to Writable in the ipc package
item.description: I see references to Writable in the ipc package, most notably in the Invocation class. This class is not being used that much in the core ipc package but used in the coprocessor protocol implementations (there are some coprocessor protocols that are Writable based still). This jira is to track removing those references and the Invocation class (once HBASE-6895 is resolved).
item.summary: Remove references to Writable in the ipc package

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Here is a patch purging Writables from io. Could be integrated w/ whatever happens in here.
Here is some more writable cleanup under ipc. Hard stuff still to be done.
We should have this jira be blocked by HBASE-6895. Once HBASE-6895 goes in, we could remove Invocation class as well..

This patch removes Invocation too. The Writables that remain are in HBaseServer answering SASL, which seems harmless, then there is the VersionedProtocol stuff. Can we get rid of this stuff? The ProtocolSignature stuff? It is Writables based. Should we do it in a different issue as part of the rpc rejiggering?

Undoing reference to HbaseObjectWritable from TablePermissions. Added test that verifies TablePermissions can read old Writables serialization as well as new pb. Still need to undo parameter setting in Multi* so can let go of HbaseObjectWritable.

This message is automatically generated.

The Writables that remain are in HBaseServer answering SASL, which seems harmless,

Yeah they seem harmless, and the usage of Writable here is probably never going to change (the writable there is BytesWritable, and that's a very simple wrapper around bytes).

then there is the VersionedProtocol stuff. Can we get rid of this stuff? The ProtocolSignature stuff? It is Writables based. Should we do it in a different issue as part of the rpc rejiggering?

We should decide what to do about the versioning/signature. Currently, this stuff is not used in any meaningful way and can be removed. Should we remove these as part of this patch is a question. I had raised HBASE-6521 a while back for addressing the versioning in the new PB world.

Patch that removes Invocation, HbaseObjectWritable (its needed migrating TablePermissions so I moved this class into security subpackage and shut down all but package private access). We also change rpc so we just pass Results rather than 'named' Results (we were passing a NameBytePair where the name was the Result class name).

Should we remove these as part of this patch is a question. I had raised HBASE-6521 a while back for addressing the versioning in the new PB world.

Lets do the fixup in hbase-6521. I made it a blocker on 0.96. As you say, what is there now makes no sense.

So, this patch is good enough to close out this issue? Let me post on rb.

I added it to rb here: https://reviews.apache.org/r/8755/

The remaining Writables that are in ipc will be untangled as part of hbase-6521 effort.
